title.narrative: Break through of farmer led dairy business

description.narrative:
MVIWAMBO is a dairy farmers group net-work formed of 17 Dairy farmer groups to enhance quantity and quality milk production and processing. Location of the organization is in Mbozi District south west of Tanzania. The organization was registered on 12 the February 2004 with the ministry of Home affairs as an NGO or CBO (None Government organization/community Based Organization ) with Reg.No so.12344,and is the only Dairy farmer organization in the District. The members (Dairy farmers) Count 1.135 in number -in year 2010. The main objective of the organization is to carry out all activities conductive to the promotion of development for increased milk production, processing, marketing and consumption ,and thus the economic well being of Dairy farmers and the community as a whole. The proposed project is to conduct training on dairy business activities. The implementations of the activities will be done partially by its members and or by hired experts under the organization supervision.
2012: RATIONALE/JUSTIFICATION OF THIS PROJECT Mviwambo’s main ambition is to realize a dairy plant owned by its members through shares. This factory will but all milk locally produced, processes it to high quality dairy products that will be sold at the local/regional markets, hence resulting in a better income for dairy farmers. A group of Dutch farmers, all member of ZLTO, the Farmers Association of Southern Netherlands, have established Foundation Kuungana in 2009 by the members of a group of farmers from ZLTO. Mviwambo and the Dutch farmers from Kuungana established relationships since 2006.The farmers from Kuungana and Mviwambo have agreed to participate ( financially) in a new dairy processing plant in Vwawa. Both parties prepared a business plan for the farmers owned processing plant.
The project 11mvi-5704 (started in 2011) focuses on training and extension programmes to dairy farmers with the aim to improve the milk production in quality and quantity and includes institutional support to the management of Mviwambo and to be establishing factory. During the year 2011 the project was implemented by the staff and board members of Mviwambo.Although it is too early to assess the impact of this project, there is sufficient evidence of concrete positive results at the farmer’s level and at the group level. Farmers are applying (part of the) newly acquired knowledge to cultivate fodder crops with as better milk, production per animal, farmers improve the stables of the animals, farmers prove additional nutrients to the animals. Record keeping and cooperative management issues are seriously addressed by Mviwambo since two years. Due to training and awareness, many groups have changed the leaders recently and groups seem to become more active. Systematic record keeping by groups/individuals is done but needs further improvement/follow up, especially with the eye on the future establishing a dairy processing plant owned by Mviwambo. This project proposal for 2012 is in fact a continuation of the 2011 project which was designed for 2 years.
PROJECT OBJECTIVES AND ACTIVITIES In order to realize the dairy processing plant it is important to increase milk production, both in quality and quantity. At the same time, DFG management skills needs to be strengthened as farmers have to cooperate in for example milk collection. The following objectives need to be addresses in 2012.  Objective 1: Increase the milk production and milk quality In collaboration with ULRC (UYOLE Livestock Research Center) and for sustainability, proposed the following activities will be carried out in three (3) years  Establishment of improved pastures and forages (Rhodes grass, Desmodium, Napier grass and Multipurpose trees)  Proper collection of crop residues for dry season feeding  Harvesting and preventing/treatment of fodder for dry season feeding
Objective 2: Strengthen financial management in DFGs Mviwambo will conduct leadership and financial management trainings at two selected centers which will accommodate a class of 32 participants at one time. This will result in total of 24 sessions with expected 64 participants representing all DFGs.
Objective 3: Facilitation in cross-learning and exchange Mviwambo and Uyole LRC will conduct a cross-learning training of 60 dairy farmers to Mufindi and Njombe districts.
Objective 4: Enhance understanding on commitment of DFGs to the proposed dairy plant Mviwambo will conduct open training meeting in each DFG which will accommodate a meeting of average of 64 participants at one time. This will result in total of 17 session with expected 1088 participants in all DFGs. (This meeting will include DFGs’ members and non-DFGs’ members who keep dairy cattle)
2011 INTRODUCTION : MVIWAMBO is a dairy farmers group net-work formed of 17 Dairy farmer groups to enhance quantity and quality milk production and processing. Location of the organization is in Mbozi District south west of Tanzania. The organization was registered on 12 the February 2004 with the ministry of Home affairs as an NGO or CBO (None Government organization/community Based Organization ) with Reg.No so.12344,and is the only Dairy farmer organization in the District. The members (Dairy farmers) Count 1.135 in number -in year 2010. The main objective of the organization is to carry out all activities conductive to the promotion of development for increased milk production, processing, marketing and consumption ,and thus the economic well being of Dairy farmers and the community as a whole. The proposed project is to conduct training on dairy business activities. The implementations of the activities will be done partially by its members and or by hired experts under the organization supervision.
OVER ALL OBJECTIVE : Improve milk production and income in Households to boost milk collection in collecting centers.
Specific objectives: (i) To change the mindset of a farmer over many small /un economized crop farming units to economical dairy farming. (ii) To facilitate sustainable quantity and quality milk production by training farmers on proper dairy cattle management and . (iii) To assure the farmer on the availability of a permanent, dependable milk market channel by working on establishing a milk processing plant.
The project is aimed at all Dairy farmers within the Net-work area . 1135 (53 women) and later to win the whole District area ready for the anticipated milk processing plant.
METHODOLOGY A group of 50 dairy farmers, selected from 10 active groups (5 Participants from each group) will attend the training sessions of the year, which will be done twice per week at a proposed convenient venue(Mkonongo Hall) Situated at the centres of District. 25 participants will create a class. Each of these trained farmers will bridge knowledge to their DFG members, thus Trained Trainers (TT). To achieve the net –work goal, the project is assumed to last for 5 months starting from May to early October 2011. 6. From the 5 trainees of each group, one participant will be assigned head of the DGF trainers In this way out of the 50 participants there will be 5 TOT heads who will also form a follow up committee in Households to make sure that the knowledge has been briddged properly and is put into practice at all Dairy farmers House Holds . Achievements will be reported to the organization in quarterly bases.
TRAINING CONTENTS. The training will comprise the following topics. 1. Types of records to be kept at House hold level and at milk collecting centres. 2. Proper and improved animal husbandry 3. Access to different types of folder best for dairy cattle. 4. Types of animal feeds 5. Forage establishment and husbandry. 6. Nutritive value at different growth levels 7. Harvesting and preservation (methods) & practice) 8. Sagastive steaming rations (composition) 9. Feeding during dry period & rainy season. 10. Heat detection in cows and service provision.(Natural or A.l). 11. Rate of conception 12. Average milk production in 305 days per lactation 13. Calf Caring from 3-4 months age. 14. Heifer management to calfing down 15. Diseases control in Dairy cows. 16. Dairy farm records etc. 17. Hyginec milk production . 18. Dairy farmer household challenges.
TRAINING MATERIALS REQUIRED Training materials will include Hand outs prepared by the trainer Booklets /pamphlets Some leaflets and some samples according to topics
APPROACHESTrain the beneficiaries in a participatory way followed by fortification of what is totally new. Use of practical and theoretical ideas Practical field exposures at Uyole research institute ,Langwira farm Gender sensitization with an emphasis on equal participation and sharing of responsibilities and benefits. Create HIV awareness to dairy farmer community.
EXPECTED RESULTS:Animal health improved Animal feeds and feeding improved Average milk production increased from 7 lit to 14 lit per day in 305 days lactation period. Conception rate improved from 63% to 85% through A.l application. Dairy animal breeds improved through A.l application. Dairy farmers awareness on good and Economical Breeds enhanced. Production cost reduced through proper feeding of dairy cattle and therefore profit Margin increased. Through cross cutting issues - (HIV )awareness enhanced and -Gender issues improved.
MONITORING & EVALUATION. Out of five farmers who attended a training in feeds and feeding of dairy cattle, one the leader will join the co. Leaders to form an advisory committee which will go in every Dairy farmers household to inspect or advice on the good Dairy cattle management for best milk production, feeds and feeding practices and other milk hygienic practices. This follow up will be done in after every there month a report will be sent to the organization for action .This practice has proved beneficial in Vwawa Dairy cop-society its management depends a lot on it for records and reaction.
to improve the milk production in quality and quantity and institutional support to the management of Mviwambo in order to establish a dairy factory, resulting in better income for dairy farmers
